column4: heya, does anyone know how to get the source code for a package?
If you have the deb-src lines for the repository, use apt-get source packagename
thanks!  apt-get source!  whoulda thunk?
You don't need sudo for that either, it will download the files to the current directory.
thanks, I just tried it w/o sudo and am glad to see that it did what I expected
any clue on building packages then?  like if I want to test something out?
sorry - duh! it was just a ./configure
See http://wiki.ubuntu.com/PackagingGuide
banned him...
install apt-file, run sudo apt-file update then: apt-file search libtermcap.so.2
jrlb: thanks!
isn't dist-upgrade now called full-upgrade?
Only in aptitude
ah, ok.  thanks!
And aptitude is a bit more forgiving when it comes to packages that depend on new packages now. But the remove stuff is the same.  Its manpage has more details.
DefamedPrawn: does that need to be done for each mounted filesystem, for /boot (if it's separate) or just for / ?
I *think* it just needs to be done on / , but I'm not 100% sure on that.
10.04 is not released, merely the release candidate, please use #ubuntu+1 for discussion
I don't see any packages in our archives that provide that file.... I'd check your auth log.
Its no longer supported upstream, was removed from debian and then us: see http://bugs.debian.org/521175
You aren't identified either.
how is it that I am not identified?  I've got a registered nick and set it up in pidgin to sign me in?
ubottu.com is having issues. thus no ubottu, and why the floodbots are flopping around
i was wondering about the floodbots...
